items.sentence: I ended up telling Tom what you told me not to tell him.
Tom can read some French, but he can\'t speak it at all.
Tom can\'t bear the thought of Mary going out with John.
I was curious to know why people had been staring at me.
I was very thirsty and I wanted to drink something cold.
I had the impression Tom didn\'t know what was going on.
I just got off the train and I\'m still on the platform.
I\'d like to know why my name was deleted from the list.
Tom\'s French pronunciation is much better than Mary\'s.
Tom\'s wife\'s name is Mary and his son\'s name is John.
Tom asked Mary some questions that she couldn\'t answer.
Tom isn\'t the kind of person I want dating my daughter.
I\'m pretty sure that Tom is going to help Mary do that.
She asked me what had become of him, but I didn\'t know.
She looks young, but actually she\'s older than you are.
I\'ve tried to get along with Tom, but it\'s impossible.
If Tom could\'ve spoken French, he\'d have had more fun.
Tom opened a can of soup and emptied it into a saucepan.
Tom says that he has to attend a meeting this afternoon.
Tom told me that he wanted me to buy a painting for him.
